task1.questionText: What does the operator `:-` mean Prolog?

task2.questionText: What does `X \= Y` mean in a rule?

task3.questionText:
Given the following facts:```character(professor).
character(vicky).
character(metnik).```What will the query `character(_)` output?

task4.questionText: How do you split the list `[1, 2, 3, 4]` into two lists: `[1, 2]` and `[3, 4]`?

inception1_start.speaker: vicky
inception1_start.dialogue: Yes! Haha... So, who’s smarter now? The FBI’s protection isn’t that scary after all...

inception1_02.dialogue: Alright, what do we have here... Wow... So, they want to ask my father for help.

inception1_03.dialogue: A group of hackers led by Kevin Mitnick created a dangerous virus.

inception1_04.dialogue: It's capable of erasing all data from computer memory, disrupting the global network, and spreading through simple communications.

inception1_05.dialogue: The computer of cybersecurity specialist Sarah Parker was hacked, and this virus was launched into the network.

inception1_06.dialogue: If we don't create the antivirus in the Prolog language, global chaos and disasters will ensue.

inception1_07.dialogue: Sarah Parker was kidnapped from her own home last night. The FBI doesn't know her whereabouts.

inception1_08.dialogue: But they managed to locate the computer where the antivirus needs to be entered. In a mansion with deadly traps...

inception1_09.dialogue: What a situation... I'm sure I'll handle this faster than my father... Let's see where they are headed...

inception1_10.dialogue: Got it, they’ll go to the main entrance... Alright, let’s see if there’s a back entrance.
inception1_10.speaker: vicky

inception1_11.dialogue: Aha, there is… Alright, I’ll go through it, and then we’ll see who completes the task faster and saves the world!
inception1_11.speaker: vicky

inception1_12.dialogue: Well then, let’s go! Time is running out. I have to get there before my father does.

inception1_13.dialogue: But first I need a taxi... Hello, good evening! I urgently need a lift to...

inception2_start.speaker: vicky
inception2_start.dialogue: Wow, it's so overgrown here. Nobody has been here in a long time... What are these strange mechanical sounds? I need to hide.

inception2_01.dialogue: Aaaaaa. Let me go, you filthy pervert! Take this... aaaah...

inception2_02.dialogue: Waaah, aaaah... Why are you attacking me right away, miss?! I’m just an R3 model robot, assistant to humans. And you immediately hit me!
inception2_02.speaker: robot

inception2_03.dialogue: Unbelievable! This robot is so emotional! Sorry, I didn’t mean to. Why did you grab my leg in the first place?
inception2_03.speaker: vicky

inception2_04.dialogue: I only wanted to protect you, miss. It’s forbidden to walk in these places!
inception2_04.speaker: robot

inception2_05.dialogue: Alright, stop crying already. I just really need to get inside! It’s a matter of life and death!
inception2_05.speaker: vicky

inception2_06.dialogue: I am a third-generation robot, model R3. I must not let a living being enter here. There are deadly traps in the mansion. Why did you come here, miss?
inception2_06.speaker: robot

inception2_07.dialogue: You’re a human-assistant robot. That means it’s your duty to listen and help any human. Isn’t that right? And stop crying already!
inception2_07.speaker: vicky

inception2_08.dialogue: Honestly, this is the first time I’ve seen a machine so emotional!

inception2_09.dialogue: I have a robot vacuum at home, and I just imagined it crying every time it sees a floor littered with chips.

inception2_10.dialogue: Yes, miss, that would indeed be strange...
inception2_10.speaker: robot

inception2_11.dialogue: So will you help me get into the house? Kevin Mitnick created a virus capable of disrupting the entire global network. He has already launched it.
inception2_11.speaker: vicky

inception2_12.dialogue: There are less than 18 hours left to create an antivirus in the Prolog language. I really hope you’ll help me learn it.

inception2_13.dialogue: Yes, I have such functionality. All the traps can be bypassed if you know this language. But to study Prolog, you need to step away from traditional programming paradigms...
inception2_13.speaker: robot

inception2_14.dialogue: Believe me, it’s a very elegant and logical language. You’ll soon appreciate its beauty and possibilities.

inception2_15.dialogue: I’m sure I will. Can we get started with the lesson?
inception2_15.speaker: vicky

inception2_18.dialogue: Alright, miss. I'll lead the way.

inception3_start.speaker: vicky
inception3_start.dialogue: Phew... we opened this heavy door... it's so dark and damp.. Ah-choo!.. Ah-choo!...

inception3_02.dialogue: There’s more dust here than in all of Kagoshima on Kyushu Island! It's like no one has been here for ages!
inception3_02.speaker: vicky

inception3_03.dialogue: You're right, the back door really hasn’t been used in a very long time. Almost no one knows about it.
inception3_03.speaker: robot

inception3_04.dialogue: Information about it is only in the earliest blueprints, which were redone many times, and the back door was seemingly forgotten. I'm amazed that you knew it existed!
inception3_04.speaker: robot

inception3_05.dialogue: I found mentions of the very first design of the house. It talked about the back door. Its design was probably inspired by those in the video game 'Metro 2033.'
inception3_05.speaker: vicky

inception3_06.dialogue: Just look at this! There are some sort of mutagens or minerals hanging from the ceiling, and mold is everywhere. Ew, what a nightmare!

inception3_07.dialogue: This place looks creepy and very unpleasant...
inception3_07.speaker: robot

inception3_08.dialogue: Oh, look! There’s a staircase ahead!
inception3_08.speaker: vicky

inception3_09.dialogue: Be careful, miss! Some steps have traps!
inception3_09.speaker: robot

inception3_failTask2_01.dialogue: Oh no, I have to think again...
inception3_failTask2_01.speaker: vicky

inception3_11.dialogue: Okay, we got past this trap...
inception3_11.speaker: vicky

inception3_12.dialogue: Careful, miss! There is another here.
inception3_12.speaker: robot

inception3_failTask3_01.dialogue: Oh no... Time to try again.
inception3_failTask3_01.speaker: vicky

inception3_14.dialogue: So, If I remember the plans correctly, it will be easy to get to the study room from here.
inception3_14.speaker: vicky

inception4_start.speaker: vicky
inception4_start.dialogue: Whoa! Look at this massive door! It looks like it's made of titanium. And again, it opens with a code...

inception4_01.dialogue: You’ve already completed two tasks, miss! You can do it!
inception4_01.speaker: robot

inception4_02.dialogue: I have no doubt! Wait! Do you hear that?!
inception4_02.speaker: vicky

inception4_03.dialogue: There's definitely someone behind the door!
inception4_03.speaker: robot

inception4_04.dialogue: What if it’s Mitnik?! Do you have a weapon?
inception4_04.speaker: vicky

inception4_05.dialogue: No, miss! I cannot harm a human!
inception4_05.speaker: robot

inception4_06.dialogue: People are different, and some could really use a little harm. I’ll grab my knife. It’s better than nothing! Let’s try to catch Mitnik off guard!
inception4_06.speaker: vicky

inception4_07.dialogue: I don’t think that’s a very good idea, miss! If I were you, I’d be more cautious! I’m scared!
inception4_07.speaker: robot

inception4_08.dialogue: The scariest thing will happen if we don't finish all tasks within six hours! Then humanity is doomed!
inception4_08.speaker: vicky

inception4_09.dialogue: Yes, let’s move on to the next task!
inception4_09.speaker: robot

inception4_failTask4_01.dialogue: Be careful, miss! Or else we won't be able to unlock the door.

inception4_11.dialogue: Okay miss, the door is unlocked, now we can proceed to the study room.
inception4_11.speaker: robot

gameOver_1.dialogue: I shouldn't have wasted all my tries...
